channel.title: The Canman Show
channel.description: What your Mom would be listening to if she were an arts-supportin', movie watchin', video game playin', zombie killin', disco stick ridin'... beer drinking techno geek. Oh, she is? Have her listen to this show, We're all really hot.

What your Mom would be listening to if she were an arts-supportin', movie watchin', video game playin', zombie killin', disco stick ridin'... beer drinking techno geek.
Oh, she is?
Have her listen to this show!
We're all really hot.

item.title: #152 - The Canman Show - "Season Finale 2011-2012"
item.description:
Present:

  • Chad "Canman" Canfield
  • Kevin Coppess

We Discussed:

  • How this is our 2011-2012 Season Finale.   We will return in September 2012 with all new episodes!   Keep watching the site this summer for some of our "LOST EPISODES of THE CANMAN SHOW!!!"
  • This episode was very comic book centric!  If you are a comic nerd you should enjoy!
  • Thanks so much for Listening!
item.itunes:subtitle:
Present:
Chad "Canman" Canfield Kevin Coppess
We Discussed:

item.description:

  • Jonny Midday
  • Kevin Coppess
  • Chad "Canman" Canfield

WE DISCUSSED:

  • The Canfield Family cruise on The Oasis of the Seas.
  • Popeye's Chicken
  • White People change color when they get pissed off... and they eat steak every day.
  • Board Games being made into movies and a gritty reboot of Shoots and Ladders.
  • Tooth Fairy Enforcers AKA TF ENFORCERS.
  • Canman begs you to go see Star Wars Episode 1 3D in the theater.
  • African American or Black?  Which do you prefer?
  • Jonny bench pressing 500 lbs.
  • Black History Month.
  • Improv.
  • Much, Much More....

Music: "Auld Lang Syne Happy New Year" by J.E.L.L.i. Check out his website and buy his stuff HERE! As Mentioned on the show: CCG info:
Central Corridor Gamers to offer safe, warm fun for Corridor youth this New Years Eve.
Join Central Corridor Gamers this Thursday evening from 6 in the evening until after midnight for open tabletop gaming, free pizza, snacks, and camaraderie. Parents are encouraged to bring or join their children for any number of tabletop and card gaming events. Most organized tourrnaments are free to enter with a few exceptions. This event has been designed to allow individuals a safe and warm environment for the New Years holiday. During this time, supervisors will be on site organizing events and maintaining a positive environment. Alcohol and drugs will NOT be allowed and individuals who are under the influence will be asked to leave immediately. Learning new games or making new friends is encouraged.
Wizards of the Coast (a subsidiary of Hasbro) has generously provided us with FREE Pizza Hut pizza for the evening. Popcorn and cookies will be also be provided. Video Games Etc! has provided prizes for various events and material for one Magic: The Gathering tournament event*. See list below for the various events we will be hosting and their respective entry fees.
Organized events will include the following:
FREE Yu-Gi-Oh tournament and open gaming
FREE Pokmon tournament and/or open gaming
FREE Magic: The Gathering draft tournament *Open to the first 8 players who sign up.*
Magic: The Gathering draft tournament - $9.00 entry fee
Magic: The Gathering standard tournament - $1.00 entry fee
Open tables for any tabletop game ie: HeroClix, Heroscape, Scrabble, Trivial Pursuit, etc. etc.
Members of the media are encouraged to help us to publicize this event throughout the week so that we achieve maximum attendance. Central Corridor Gamers is a non-profit organization striving to improve our community. Our mission is to instill within Cedar Rapids youth and adults concepts such as positive behavior, sportsmanship, and camaraderie by means of game-related events, outreach, fundraising, and volunteer opportunities.
To speak with organizer, Dan Alpers or schedule an interview, feel free to call 319.363.5799 or e-mail dan@ccgamers.org.

item.title: The Canman Show Episode 3
item.description: In this episode we discuss: Fun things we like to do with our kids,Our favorite podcasts and Upcoming events in the corridor. Well be premiering Ryans Star Wars Minute and we have a report from our lovely and talented Alisabeth Carraway on a project shes working on with Frightmare Forest Productions and how you can get involved.

item.title: The Canman Show Episode 2
item.description:
Timmys gone on military duty so we have a special guest host Ryan Schoenhard. We discuss his visit to Dragon Con and Bryan Humphreys photos. Kevin brings up the Fall Tv shows hes looking forward to checking out then we discuss some hot Star Wars action.
Canman interviews Dan Alpers with Central Corridor Gamers and Rob Merritt with Theatre Cedar Rapids.

item.title: The Canman Show Episode 1
item.description:
Here it is! Episode 1 of The Canman Show. Please check it out! Special thanks to Timmy, Kevin, Alisabeth, Seth and The B-Sea Surfers for the use of their music! Its a little rough, but hey its our first episode. Well get better, we promise.
Topics discussed:
Theatre Cedar Rapids Volunteer Opportunities X-box 360 upcoming games Our family issues The new Star Wars figures
